subject: Time to report plant survival count for ReTree Hawaii event Monday, May 12, 2025
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

It has been more than three months since the 2025-05-12 planting event! We wanted to follow up to see how the plants have fared since they got in the ground and are asking all site organizers to let us know the number of plants still hanging in there at this time. You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

subject: msgdb038dc546ab9
sendername: NULL

subject: How did the planting go?
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Amanda Manning House participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-05-06! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

subject: ReTree Hawaii - event at Keālia Pond National Wlldlife Refuge on 2025-09-06  updated
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

The event by ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-09-06 has been updated at ReTree Hawaii!

\n

Thank you for updating the event by ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-09-06 at retree-hawaii.org!

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any additional changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any additional changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

subject: How did the planting go?
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Not applicable participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-07-02! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

It has been more than three months since the 2025-05-12 planting event! We wanted to follow up to see how the plants have fared since they got in the ground and are asking all site organizers to let us know the number of plants still hanging in there at this time. You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

\n

Thank you again for having Laakea Village participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-06-27! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

info@retree-hawaii.org

sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Mauna Kahalawai Watershed Partnership participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-04-22! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

It has been more than three months since the 2025-05-12 planting event! We wanted to follow up to see how the plants have fared since they got in the ground and are asking all site organizers to let us know the number of plants still hanging in there at this time. You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

subject: msg9711e3a5f1e07
ReTree Hawaii - event at Keālia Pond National Wlldlife Refuge on 2025-09-06  created
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Thank you for registering ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-09-06!

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

subject: msg83c7d0fcde52f
sendername: NULL

Thank you again for having Mauna Kahalawai Watershed Partnership participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-04-19! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Event results reported for ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-07-25
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

The event by ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-07-25 has reported the results.

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators

The event by ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-07-25 has reported the results.

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators

subject: How did the planting go?
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Not applicable participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-07-02! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

ReTree Hawaii - event at In Honor of Ancil Clancy Planting on 2025-05-25  created
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Thank you for registering Ancil Clancy Foundation at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-05-25!

\n<td>Ancil was a champion for growing trees and volunteering for native plant restoration. He wanted people to grow more trees, especially natives. So please, in lieu of flowers, plant a tree in his name if you would like to honor him somewhere. He would love to know that his passing resulted in more trees being planted.
\nThis will be his celebration of life and we will distribute plants to family, loved ones, and friends to plant trees in honor of his life.

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

\nThis will be his celebration of life and we will distribute plants to family, loved ones, and friends to plant trees in honor of his life.

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

The event by ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-07-25 has reported the results.

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Keālia Pond National Wlldlife Refuge participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-06-20! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Tate of Mind participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-05-31! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having La'akea Village participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-03-10! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

subject: Time to report plant survival count for ReTree Hawaii event Monday, March 10, 2025
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

It has been more than three months since the 2025-03-10 planting event! We wanted to follow up to see how the plants have fared since they got in the ground and are asking all site organizers to let us know the number of plants still hanging in there at this time. You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

\n

The event by ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku on 2025-03-01 has reported the results.

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Surfing the Nations participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-07-18! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

subject: msgbf3d1081905fc
sendername: NULL

subject: New Plant Request Received
sendername: ReTree Hawaii
message:
SiteWorldspot Kamaole I
RequesterRob Weltman <robw@worldspot.com>
Phone808-123-4567
Date2026-12-25
Pickup Date2026-12-24

For kukui and ‘ulu: Andy Fox, 1300 Haliimaile Rd; 808-283-3720
For other plants: Maui Native Nursery, 1267 Na'alae Road, Kula; (808) 878-8276; Monday-Friday 8:00am-4:00pm

NameScientificCount
‘a‘ali‘iDodonaea viscosa1
wiliwiliErythrina sandwicensis2
piliHeteropogon contortus1
‘ōhi‘aMetrosideros polymorpha1
pōhinahinaVitex rotundifolia1

Total: 6

Additional: That's it

We will review your request and consult with Maui Native Nursery then get back to you.

Note: many environments in Hawai‘i need special attention to irrigation and/or predator (deer, goats, pigs) protection for plants to survive. We can provide advice in many cases.

You can also review Maui County's recommendations for plants in five different climate zones.

Thank you again for having UDV participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-06-17! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

subject: How did the planting go?
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Mauna Kahalawai Watershed Partnership participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-04-19! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

It has been more than three months since the 2025-03-10 planting event! We wanted to follow up to see how the plants have fared since they got in the ground and are asking all site organizers to let us know the number of plants still hanging in there at this time. You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Thank you for registering Surfing the Nations at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-07-18!

\n45 Koele Way is property of Surfing the Nations and housing for missionaries who come to serve. It's a place we can host people and show them the beauty of Hawaii. We desire to bring local beauty to the location and show the elegance of the native plants.

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

subject: ReTree Hawaii - event at 45 Koele Way, Wahiawa HI 96786 on 2025-07-17  created
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Thank you for registering Surfing the Nations at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-07-17!

\n45 Koele Way is property of Surfing the Nations and housing for missionaries who come to serve. It's a place we can host people and show them the beauty of Hawaii. We desire to bring local beauty to the location and show the elegance of the native plants.

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

subject: New Plant Request Received
sendername: ReTree Hawaii
message:
SiteWahiawa Koele Way
RequesterCinday Bauer <cindy@stn.global>
Phone808-123-4567
Date2025-07-07
Pickup Date2025-07-06

For kukui and ‘ulu:  Andy Fox, 1300 Haliimaile Rd; 808-283-3720
For other plants:  Maui Native Nursery, 1267 Na'alae Road, Kula; (808) 878-8276; Monday-Friday 8am-4pm

NameScientificCount

Additional: I need to acquire if available, pohinahina, mamaki, citrus trees, hibiscus, and what else is available right now? Please email me. Please contact via email

Total: 0

We will review your request and consult with Maui Native Nursery, then get back to you.

Note: many environments in Hawai‘i need special attention to irrigation and/or predator (deer, goats, pigs) protection for plants to survive. We can provide advice in many cases.

You can also review Maui County's recommendations for plants in five different climate zones.

subject: ReTree Hawaii - event at Keālia Pond National Wlldlife Refuge on 2025-03-01  created
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Thank you for registering ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-03-01!

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

subject: How did the planting go?
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Riley satovich participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-06-21! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

\n

Thank you again for having Mauna Kahalawai Watershed Partnership participate in the state-wide planting campaign on 2025-03-14! Your site may have welcomed volunteers or it may have been restricted to staff, but in either case we want to collect and publish the results!

\n

We need this information to be able to continue to support planting activities. And it is really fun to see all the planting results!

\n

You can use the link at the bottom of your site page or right here to report the number of volunteers and plants - and preferably provide pictures as well:

\n

If the event happened but on a different date, or if it hasn't happened yet but you plan to hold it in the future, you can just change the date and click on Update Site at the bottom.

\n

If the event didn't happen and there are no plans to hold it in the future, you can delete it by going to See all sites I manage and clicking on the X next to the one you want to delete.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles using the page to report results, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

Please reply to:
info@retree-hawaii.org

subject: Time to report plant survival count for ReTree Hawaii event Monday, March 10, 2025
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

It has been more than three months since the 2025-03-10 planting event! We wanted to follow up to see how the plants have fared since they got in the ground and are asking all site organizers to let us know the number of plants still hanging in there at this time. You can also (optionally) add a comment. Easy!

\n

Here's the page to enter the number of plants still with us:

subject: msg25973d7f1ed47

Time to collect the results from your planting event!

Thank you for registering ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-03-01!

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

subject: ReTree Hawaii - event at Keālia Pond National Wlldlife Refuge on 2025-03-01  created
sendername: ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘oulu Pae Moku

sent:
\n

Thank you for registering ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-03-01!
\n<td>This year the Retree/Keālia Pond NWR project will demonstrate a native plant community garden could benefit the drylands of Maui.

\nVolunteers will collect cuttings and seedlings and help expand plant communities along a nature trail.   These plant communities are designed suppress invasive species, act as a firebreak, attract pollinators and support a soil-restoring ecosystem.
\nThe plants at Keālia Pond NWR can be grown in the driest parts of the island to replace invasive grasses and shrubs.
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

\n

You can share the following link to potential volunteers to sign up at:

\n

Please visit the Web site if there are any changes to your goals for the day or any other updates.

\n

If you have any questions or run into obstacles updating the planting site, please don't hesitate to contact us at the email address below.

subject: New Plant Request Received
sendername: ReTree Hawaii
message:
SiteKeālia Pond National Wlldlife Refuge
RequesterSonny Gamponia <sgamponia@yahoo.com>
Phone808-244-0727
Date2025-07-25
Pickup Date2025-07-24

For kukui and ‘ulu:  Andy Fox, 1300 Haliimaile Rd; 808-283-3720
For other plants:  Maui Native Nursery, 1267 Na'alae Road, Kula; (808) 878-8276; Monday-Friday 8am-4pm

NameScientificCount
‘aki‘akiFimbristylis cymosa spatha-cea200

Total: 200

We will review your request and consult with Maui Native Nursery, then get back to you.

Note: many environments in Hawai‘i need special attention to irrigation and/or predator (deer, goats, pigs) protection for plants to survive. We can provide advice in many cases.

You can also review Maui County's recommendations for plants in five different climate zones.

\nECOLOGICAL GARDENING WITH NATIVE PLANTS: Learn how to start your on ecological garden at home. The native species we will be planting can survive in the driest soil and climate on the island. These little gardens, irrigated by filling an irrigation barrel once a week, will continue their growth when seasonal rainfall returns in December. These gardens are designed to build healthy soil, suppress weeds, hold moisture and support pollinators.

Thank you for registering ReTree Hawaii - Lā Ho‘olu Pae Moku at retree-hawaii.org to participate in the state-wide planting on 2025-06-20!

\nKeālia Pond NWR and Retree had our first joint event 5 years ago. The project was a native green strip to protect the visitors center from future wildfires. After 5 years of practice, we want to show you what we’ve learned about growing native plant communities in this fire prone part of the island.
\nKeālia Pond National Wildlife Refuge Visitors Center parking lot

\n
